meanings.definition: The quality or state of being savage.
meanings.sent1: The savageries of the wild animals frightened the explorers.
meanings.sent2: The savageries of the ancient tribes were well-documented in history books.
meanings.sent3: Despite their cute appearance, the puppies displayed unexpected savageries during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The savageries of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The savageries of war haunt the memories of those who have witnessed its horrors.

meanings.definition: Acts or behaviors that are brutal or cruel.
meanings.sent1: The savageries of the dictator shocked the world.
meanings.sent2: The savageries of the bullies at school were finally exposed.
meanings.sent3: The savageries of the mischievous cat included stealing socks and hiding them.
meanings.sent4: The savageries of time slowly erode even the strongest structures.
meanings.sent5: The savageries of hunger drove the desperate man to steal bread.
